id: Workshop Series: Export 101 | Wellington-1 Whitmore Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Workshop Series: Export 101 | Wellington
venue: 1 Whitmore Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Export 101 Series: Exporting to Germany and the EU A series of in-person workshops designed to equip you with the essential tools and knowledge for successful market entry and growth in Germany.
Whether you're new to exporting or looking to enhance your presence, this series is tailored to meet your needs.
This workshop series offers insider knowledge and practical advice from experienced exporters, helping you navigate the German market with confidence.
You'll learn how to leverage opportunities from the EU-NZ Free Trade Agreement, connect with peers and trade professionals, and walk away with actionable steps and tools to support your export journey.
This workshop series is proudly sponsored by bnz, Go Logistics, and Messe Berlin, in partnership with EMA.

id: Welly Green Thinks - Winter Edition-Odlins Square, Taranaki Wharf 2 Taranaki Street, Waterfront, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Welly Green Thinks - Winter Edition
venue: Odlins Square, Taranaki Wharf 2 Taranaki Street, Waterfront, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Integrating Regenerative Thinking in Adaptation Join us for a morning discussion aimed at intertwining regenerative thinking with climate adaptation.
We will look beyond traditional approaches for addressing climate change including flooding, sea-level rise, urban heat and hydrological impacts.
Featuring compelling international case studies, including a hallmark of proactive climate adaptation planning, the Denmark’s iconic “cloudburst” stormwater management.
We will challenge attendees to adopt a systemic approach to overcoming climate challenges.
Be part of the conversation that aims to shape sustainable and resilient futures for our communities.

id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Hamilton-15 Turakina Rise, Rototuna North, Hamilton 3210-Humanitix
name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Hamilton
venue: 15 Turakina Rise, Rototuna North, Hamilton 3210
description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Auckland-11th Floor, 99 Albert Street Auckland, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Auckland
venue: 11th Floor, 99 Albert Street Auckland, New Zealand
description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

id: July Work Smarter Horowhenua. Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses-102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: July Work Smarter Horowhenua. Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses
venue: 102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
description:
More people are using AI, without understanding how it works, without telling their employers that they are using it, without considering the implications, and without knowing how to get the most from the tools they’re using.
This is where AI literacy becomes essential - it’s not just knowing how to use AI tools, it’s about understanding what’s possible, and knowing you don’t need to be technically savvy to use it well.
You’ll walk away with: A clear, practical understanding of how AI works and how to use it Proven tools tailored for small businesses Plug-and-play workflows to save time and reduce mental load Confidence to use AI without compromising your brand, your values, or your people.
No tech jargon.
I’ve come away with a whole lot more knowledge and food for thought than I was anticipating and feel empowered to start implementing AI tools from today.” About Lizi Guest (your workshop facilitator) I’m the founder of Little & Loud, an award-winning public relations and communications agency that’s worked with more than a hundred organisations; from local councils and government agencies to fast-growing businesses and national brands.

id: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses-102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: August Work Smarter Horowhenua - Everyday AI for Everyday Businesses
venue: 102 Liverpool Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
description:
More people are using AI, without understanding how it works, without telling their employers that they are using it, without considering the implications, and without knowing how to get the most from the tools they’re using.
This is where AI literacy becomes essential - it’s not just knowing how to use AI tools, it’s about understanding what’s possible, and knowing you don’t need to be technically savvy to use it well.
This practical two-hour in-person workshop is for real people in real businesses; who want to use AI to do more with the resources and tools they already have.
No tech jargon.
I’ve spent my career helping teams work smarter, minimise risks and leverage opportunities that come from doing business in our fast-changing world.

id: Beyond the Frontlines: an award-winning documentary about Palestinian humanity-65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Beyond the Frontlines: an award-winning documentary about Palestinian humanity
venue: 65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Justice for Palestine and Aotearoa Healthcare Workers for Palestine present Alexandra Dols' award-winning documentary about the impacts of dehumanising violence on Palestinian people.
In an environment where language of 'objectivity' and 'neutrality' is used to prop up colonial structures, we are proud to screen a documentary that refuses to buy into this framing.
Embark on a journey across Palestine alongside Palestinian psychiatrist Dr. Samah Jabr and discover the resistance and resilience of a people affected by the invisible wounds of war and occupation.
Check out the trailer here.
Net revenue from tickets and donations will be donated to the Gaza Mental Health Foundation: https://www.gazamentalhealth.org/ Arrive from 5.30pm for a 6pm start.

id: Dynamic Planet: Screening + Panel Discussion-10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Dynamic Planet: Screening + Panel Discussion
venue: 10 Kent Terrace, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
"With restoration of the land, comes restoration of the people."
Goodlife Collective is proud to bring this screening of Dynamic Planet by Kiwi Producer Martha Jeffries to Tara-a-Whānganui Wellington, with the support of Commonsense Organics & Greater Wellington Regional Council.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to hear from the filmmaker herself, recently returned to New Zealand after 13 years in New York.
They reveal how science, nature, and traditional knowledge can prepare us for the future.
Comprised of four episodes: Earth, Water, Fire & Ice - we will be screening the 'Earth' episode.

id: FutureVoices 2025-550 High Street, Boulcott, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: FutureVoices 2025
venue: 550 High Street, Boulcott, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
description:
Inspired by Tedx, FutureVoices 2025 will be an evening spotlighting a diverse range of passionate speakers, innovators and leaders sharing their ideas from the Wellington Youth Community on our theme for this year of ‘Redefining Tomorrow’.
FutureVoices 2025 is about empowering youth to speak up and take action using their initiatives to better local and wider communities.
Our event will take place on Friday July 18th, from 6-9pm at St Oran’s College Rutherford Art Centre, 550 High Street, Lower Hutt Wellington.
The evening will consist of 8 speakers, from a range of ages between 14 and 27.
It is a celebration of youth leadership and achievements; bold ideas and actions, and sharing youth voices and visions for a better, brighter future.

id: The Fantastic 4: First Steps - Fundraiser screening For Short film "Possum"-29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: The Fantastic 4: First Steps - Fundraiser screening For Short film "Possum"
venue: 29 Wigan Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The Fantastic 4: First Steps – Fundraiser Screening for Short Film Possum Join us for a thrilling night of a fresh reboot of The Fantastic Four.
Come support our upcoming short film "Possum" "Possum" is a 3rd year Massey University Short Film that follows a young man entering a ritualistic drinking cult.
The film is in the horror/thriller genre, think a grittier Midsummer with elements of Get Out sprinkled in.
The story is based on the real NZ drinking game, Possum, where the participants climb a tree with a box of beer and attempt to finish the beers without falling out.
If you want to learn more about our film -https://www.thearts.co.nz/boosted/projects/possum?tab=about

id: NZLSA Inaugural Alumni Breakfast-107 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: NZLSA Inaugural Alumni Breakfast
venue: 107 Customhouse Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Thanks to our friends at IPLS, NZLSA invites all former NZLSA and LSS/LSA Presidents to a complimentary breakfast at Pravda Cafe & Grill in Wellington Central.
Join us from 8:30 am onwards on Friday, 26 September, at our Inaugural Alumni Breakfast with NZLSA Patron Justice Glazebrook!

id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August-28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga August 23rd of August
venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
description:
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness.
Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc.. Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.
Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years.
He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer.

id: International Packraft Film Festival - Wellington-205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: International Packraft Film Festival - Wellington
venue: 205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Join PRANZ and Blue Duck Packrafts for the Wellington screening of the International Packrafting Film Festival 2025 What to Expect.... A night of soulful river journeys and epic whitewater.
First descents, big swims, wild country, and quiet moments.
Films by paddlers, for paddlers — with stories that matter.
A chance to connect with the local community and chat with local suppliers.
Spot prizes, chance to network with other adventurers and maybe a few surprises… Grab a drink and some nibbles from the cash bar and meet some fellow adventurers.

id: Friday Night Mahjong (Aug 2025)-17 Tinakori Road, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Friday Night Mahjong (Aug 2025)
venue: 17 Tinakori Road, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Fancy joining our Friday evening session of Mahjong?
Come along to enjoy some friendly games.
We offer a variety of Mahjong styles to suit your preference, including Cantonese, Sichuan, and Taiwanese.
We are happy to answer the occasional question during the session, but we will not be running any lessons.
Fee: $10 per person Supper: Tea, coffee and light snacks provided.

id: Hands on Deck: Cup and Saucer-1 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Hands on Deck: Cup and Saucer
venue: 1 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
Handbuild your own cup with matching saucer.
Once you’ve finished your set, choose how you want them glazed, and Laila will take it from there.
Your set will be available for pick up from Cable Top Eatery 2-3 weeks after the event.
If you live locally in Kelburn, a drop off can also be requested.
Max 7 guests per session.

id: Author Alley-289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Author Alley
venue: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
description:
Indulge in a stroll through Bookmark Kāpiti’s very own Author Alley.
Meet local authors, creatives and service providers within the workshop space of Big Mac Slabs, transformed for one day only in a book-lovers market.
Venture down to discover your next great read and make connections with others in the industry.
Come down anytime between 10–3pm.
Stallholders can register interest via our website, click here

id: Spring Céilí Dance with The Great Beag Céilí Band-81 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Spring Céilí Dance with The Great Beag Céilí Band
venue: 81 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
If you’ve never been to a céilí (or ceilidh) before, fear not - céilí dancing is very easy!
No need to bring a specific partner - there’ll be lots of friendly people to dance with.
This is an alcohol-free event.
Be safe online: Tickets are only available online from the Humanitix event.
If you are feeling unwell then please stay home and rest this time, we will see you at the next one.

id: An Invitation to Love-211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: An Invitation to Love
venue: 211 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Cantoris is excited to announce our second concert for 2025: An Invitation to Love.
Directed by Ingrid Schofield | Accompanied by Heather Easting Romantic love, sacred love, and even friendship will be captured through the works of Tallis, Ireland, Whitacre, and the shimmering centrepiece of Lauridsen's Nocturnes.
New works by Wellington's own Jonathan Berkahn sit alongside a vibrant selection of madrigals that capture the joy, longing, and playful spirit that love inspires.
We cannot wait to perform and share our love of this music with you.
🕒 Sunday 7th September | 3pm 📍  St Peter's Anglican Church | 211 Willis Street, Pōneke

id: Vocal Blokes Back on Track-209 The Parade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Vocal Blokes Back on Track
venue: 209 The Parade, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
description:
All aboard for an afternoon of music, mateship, and rhythm!
The Vocal Blokes are back — refreshed, re-energised, and ready to raise the roof with a mix of toe-tapping favourites and brand-new tunes.
Under the dynamic leadership of Music Director Paddy Shanahan, and joined by the electrifying Andreas Lepper on percussion, this isn’t your average choir concert.
Expect rich harmonies, big energy, and a few surprises.
Whether you're a longtime fan or a curious newcomer, you’ll leave smiling (and maybe singing a tune or two).

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.
Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland.
He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others.
In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers.

id: KPOP PARTY | Friends of Korea x Kick Back Events-17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: KPOP PARTY | Friends of Korea x Kick Back Events
venue: 17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Wellington’s KPOP Party: Through the Ages of KPOP!
🇰🇷 From the old school beats of SHINee and SNSD to the futuristic sounds of aespa, we’re taking you on a journey through the years of KPOP.
Come and have some fun with us on this night you won’t want to miss!
Door sales will be available if tickets are not sold out.
You can refund your ticket up to 1 days before the event.

id: Kim Churchill (Australia) LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekakariki-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Kim Churchill (Australia) LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekakariki
venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
description:
Whether you’ve followed his journey from afar or are discovering his music for the first time, this tour is set to be a celebration of song and spirit from one of Australia’s most compelling live performers.
I have three now and each year I fly between them playing festivals and seeking the far corners of world and all the beautiful places I can play music I was lucky enough to become good friends with Billy Bragg from England early on and he taught me a lot about longevity and living as an artist for the long haul.
‘Window to the Sky’ was the most played song on triple J at that time and it went on to be 42 in the Hottest 100 and is Platinum in Australia, Gold in Canada and Germany .and has over 50 million streams!
I toured it around the world as an independent self managed artist.and sold over 12 thousand tickets and played 149 concerts Now I'm back in Australia in my camper van writing this from a small town on the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia.
I’m have a new album coming out October 11th and am.

id: august meet-up ★ new project announcement!-85 Ghuznee Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: august meet-up ★ new project announcement!
venue: 85 Ghuznee Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
We have been working on a beautiful new project!
This is one that you can make and submit photographs for, to eventually share in a special event we are hosting!
This meet-up will focus on introducing to you this special project, delving into the theme, and providing some examples and inspirations to get your creativity flowing.
We will be joined by local photographers Russell Kleyn and Abigail Legg who will show us some of their photographs and chat through their process.

id: One for the Road - a queer poetry showcase-8 Chews Lane, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: One for the Road - a queer poetry showcase
venue: 8 Chews Lane, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
An intoxicating night of poetry reading at elixir, Pōneke's most enchanting boutique cocktail bar, featuring a diverse cast of queer poets including special guest essa may ranapiri!
Come enjoy some fine food and drink and equally fine writing in the heart of the city, the Sunday after Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, for a classy way to top off a weekend of literary events in style.
Doors open 6pm, poetry begins 6:30pm.

id: Bookmark Big Night Out-21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Bookmark Big Night Out
venue: 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
description:
Voice, music, and visuals collide in an electric celebration of people, story, and place.
Bookmark Big Night Out brings together a powerhouse lineup of musicians and storytellers: Mocean (Julia Truscott, Himiona Grace & Janet Holborow), Hinemoana Baker, Te Kahu Rolleston, and Jess Deacon, with stunning visuals by Phil Simmonds.
Experience Kāpiti storytelling like never before.
18+ Tickets are limited so get in quick!
No door sales!

id: Jason Hotton's Energy Technology Workshop- Carterton-50 Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Jason Hotton's Energy Technology Workshop- Carterton
venue: 50 Holloway Street, Carterton 5713, New Zealand
description: -Learn about our innovative Bubble Tech Triple Cone Orgonite Technology and how you can use it to create a positive impact on your health, wellbeing, consciousness and Humanity -Delve into the importance of Structured Water and its profound impact on all living things and Mother Earth -A deep dive into Tensor Technology: working with copper and sacred geometry to create life force energy to impact nature and increase your own wellbeing Finally you'll discover how the combination of these technologies will empower you to make a lasting impact on yourself and the world around you.

id: Brooklyn School Fundraiser - The Goonies at the Penthouse-205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Brooklyn School Fundraiser - The Goonies at the Penthouse
venue: 205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Join us for a nostalgic adventure to the cinema with our fundraiser screening of THE GOONIES!
Starring a very young Sean Astin and Josh Brolin!
Tickets are $25 each and all profits go towards Brooklyn School’s playground upgrade for the youngest students (Tui classrooms).
There are also some mildly scary scenes.
Parking There is a pay and display car park located on the south side of the cinema building on Ohiro Road.

id: Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand 2025-11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand 2025
venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Royal Society Te Apārangi invites you to attend Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand 2025 on Thursday 7 August where 21 participants from Aotearoa New Zealand and the Pacific Island Nations will pitch their innovative breakthrough idea for the chance to represent the region and compete at the Falling Walls Lab Global Finale in Berlin.
Attend this FREE event to hear the participants pitch their breakthrough ideas to the Falling Walls Lab Aotearoa New Zealand Jury and be inspired by these students and early-career professionals!
About Falling Walls Falling Walls Labs are organised by independent partners of Falling Walls Foundation across the globe.
The winners of each Lab travel to Berlin for the Falling Wall Lab Global Finale run by the Falling Walls Foundation.
***For event enquiries, please contact the organisers at events@royalsociety.org.nz

id: WellyForge#3, 20th August 2025-118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: WellyForge#3, 20th August 2025
venue: 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up.
The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
The August event will have see us ask the mayoral candidates for Wellington about their plans for the economy and how they see tech & science playing into them.
The event will be MCed by Wellington science journalist Peter Griffin, and, at this point, we have three candidates confirmed: Andrew Little Karl Tiefenbacher Ray Chung We won't know until 1st August who the final candidates are.
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!

id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Military Tales from the Services Section (Aug 2025)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: Military Tales from the Services Section (Aug 2025)
venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
Military Tales from the Services Area Come and hear tales from our military history.
Note: If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

id: House of Marama Vogue Night | 22nd Aug 8pm-63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: House of Marama Vogue Night | 22nd Aug 8pm
venue: 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The Mesmerising Kiki HOUSE OF MARAMA will be hosting a VOGUE NIGHT this August!
Come and get your life on Friday 22nd August at Ivy Bar & Cabaret!
Remember to check your privilege at the door.
The HOUSE OF MARAMA honours the whenua in which this event is able to take place on, belonging to the true sovereigns: Te Ātiawa iwi.
OTA = Open to All, not limited to a specific gender identity/expression, or category style.

id: New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony 2025-55-59 Thorndon Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony 2025
venue: 55-59 Thorndon Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Buy your tickets now for the 2025 New Zealand Book Awards for Children and Young Adults to join the celebration of the best books of the year for young New Zealand readers.
You’ll get to meet the finalists and applaud the winners at an exuberant awards ceremony in the characterful Pipitea Marae on Wednesday 13 August.
Their achievements will be acknowledged on the night by publishers, politicians, booksellers, librarians, media and supporters of the children’s literature community.
Members of the public are welcome to purchase tickets too.
This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so book your place today and enjoy this wonderful celebration of Aotearoa’s very best children’s literature.

id: Unity Book Club August 2025 | Before the Winter Ends-57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Unity Book Club August 2025 | Before the Winter Ends
venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
In July we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.
Drinks and snacks provided.

id: It's the Little Websites that Count-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: It's the Little Websites that Count
venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
For most current technology, it is assumed that the user is always online and has access to unlimited data.
But this assumption is only valid for regions with the infrastructure to support the internet.
As more vital communications and services transition into websites, how do we make sure that these services are still usable in areas with only low bandwidth internet or during natural disasters?
In this event we will start a discussion about developing smaller websites for accessibility in Aotearoa.
About the host Vic Roberts is a computer vision scientist who works with machine learning in medical imaging.

id: Mid-year Ceilidh-5 Woburn Road, Northland, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Mid-year Ceilidh
venue: 5 Woburn Road, Northland, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
description:
Mid-year Ceilidh is our second biggest ceilidh of the year!
Come and enjoy the dancing with live Celtic music played by the Vicfolk band!

id: Awa After Dark: Spotlighting at Korokoro Stream, Belmont Regional Park-Cornish Street, Korokoro, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Awa After Dark: Spotlighting at Korokoro Stream, Belmont Regional Park
venue: Cornish Street, Korokoro, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
description:
Explore your local awa with freshwater experts from our Wai Connection team at this spotlighting event at Korokoro Stream.
With your gumboots and a torch, head off on an evening hīkoi to your local waterway to ‘spotlight’ and observe freshwater species in their natural habitat.
Learn about the health of our waterways, freshwater conservation efforts in your neighbourhood, and some of the ways that you could become a kaitiaki of your local awa.
On the day before the event, we'll email you all the details you need to find our exact meeting location on the night.
Wai Connection is a national programme delivered by Mountains to Sea Wellington aimed at connecting local communities to their waterways to improve them.
